business.headline: Why the Strait of Hormuz matters to India amid Israel-Iran tensionsThe Strait of Hormuz is located between Iran to the north and Oman and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to the south. It connects the Persian Gulf to the Gulf of Oman, and then to the Arabian Sea.

India's unemployment rate rises to 5.6% in May 2025Rural areas saw a considerable rise in unemployment among those aged 15–29, with the rate reaching 13.7% in May from 12.3% in April. The situation was similarly difficult for urban youth, where unemployment marginally increased to 17.9% from 17.2% the previous month.

Explained: Why Vishal Mega Mart shares crashed 8% todayDespite the drop, Vishal Mega Mart's shares have done well overall this year. They have risen 18% in 2025 so far, outperforming the Nifty index, which has given a return of 5% year-to-date. Since the company's listing, the stock has gained 12%.

Explained: Why fixed deposits are losing appeal among Indian householdsOnce the go-to option for safety-first savers, fixed deposits are steadily losing favour. Read on to know what's driving the shift.

Explained: Why Dalal Street hasn't panicked amid ongoing Iran–Israel conflictDespite war jitters and foreign outflows, domestic markets held firm. With retail inflows steady and domestic themes strong, is the buy-the-dip playbook still the smartest move?
Sensex opens flat, Nifty below 25,000; Titan down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 194.71 points to 81,601.44, while the NSE Nifty lost 69 points to 24,877.50 as of 9:28 am.

Arisinfra Solutions IPO to open for bidding: All you need to knowArisinfra Solutions, a tech-driven B2B platform in the construction materials industry, is launching its IPO on June 18, seeking to raise Rs 499.60 crores.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty rise again today?At 8:12 am, the Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,957. This points to a likely flat start for the Nifty50, which closed at 24,946.5 on Monday.

Stocks to watch on June 17: TCS, HCLTech, Zee, Biocon, Hyundai, ICICI Bank, NTPCSeveral stocks will be in focus due to company announcements and other key updates. These include Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), HCL Technologies, Zee Entertainment, Biocon, Hyundai Motor India, ICICI Bank, NTPC, etc.
Sensex ends 678 points higher, Nifty above 24,900; Tata Motors falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 677.75 points to close at 81,796.15, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 227.90 points to end at 24,946.50.

Omaxe shares jump 14% on launch of New Amritsar township projectThe surge in Omaxe's share price can be attributed to the company's announcement of a new integrated township project named New Amritsar.

Air India plane crash: Will it have a negative impact on the aviation industry?The crash brought Boeing's safety record back under the scanner. Experts added that this could trigger deeper global regulatory scrutiny of Boeing's production and maintenance standards.

entertainment.headline: Rekha is not easy find: Director Muzaffar Ali on why he wouldn't remake Umrao JaanDirector Muzaffar Ali's epic musical-drama 'Umrao Jaan' is all set to re-release in theatres. In an interview recently, he talked about the possibility of remaking the 1981 cult classic and why it wouldn't make sense now.

Salman Khan and Chitrangda Singh team up for Apoorva Lakhia's next filmSalman Khan and Chitrangda Singh are set to star together for the first time in Apoorva Lakhia's upcoming military action drama. The untitled film is inspired by real events and marks a significant commercial outing for Chitrangda.

Aishwarya Rai's iconic Devdas saree created overnight, says designer Neeta LullaAishwarya Rai's iconic climax look in 'Devdas' was created overnight by designer Neeta Lulla after a last-minute request from director Sanjay Leela Bhansali. The dramatic saree scene became one of the film's most memorable moments and contributed to its National Award-winning costume design.

Aditi Rao Hydari opens up about career gaps after Heeramandi success: Still waitingDespite receiving immense praise for her role in 'Heeramandi', Aditi Rao Hydari revealed she hasn't signed a new project yet. She also opened up about the ongoing challenges women face in the entertainment industry.

Priyanka Chopra mourns her uncle's death, offers condolences to Mannara Actor Priyanka Chopra offered condolences to her family members, cousin Mannara Chopra, after the death of the latter's father. She shared a note on her Instagram stories.

Akshay Kumar's Welcome To The Jungle delayed again due to payment issues: ReportAkshay Kumar's highly anticipated film, 'Welcome To The Jungle' (Welcome 3), is reportedly facing financial trouble, which halted the film's production since August 2023. The film was originally scheduled to release on December 20, 2024.

Madhavan, Fatima Sana Shaikh's Aap Jaisa Koi to release on Netflix in JulyThe release date of 'Aap Jaisa Koi', Netflix's upcoming romance drama, is out. It stars R Madhavan and Fatima Sana Shaikh in lead roles.

Al Pacino becomes first actor to meet Pope Leo XIVLegendary actor Al Pacino met with Pope Leo XIV on Monday, becoming the first-ever movie star to do so. The 85-year-old icon marked a historic moment with this meeting.

Diljit Dosanjh, Ahan Shetty start shooting Border 2 with Sunny Deol, Varun DhawanThe third schedule for 'Border 2' has begun in Pune, with actors Diljit Dosanjh and Ahan Shetty joining the rest of the cast. The film is being directed by Anurag Singh and also stars Sunny Deol and Varun Dhawan in important roles.

Actor Eric Dane breaks silence on ALS battle: Will lose left side mobility soonActor Eric Dane opened up about his battle with ALS. In a heartbreaking interview, he grew emotional while discussing his diagnosis, revealing that one of his arms has completely stopped functioning.

Mohanlal's Thudaram accused of plagiarism by director Sanal Kumar SasidharanMalayalam director Sanal Kumar Sasidharan accused the makers of Mohanlal's 'Thudarum' of plagiarism. He alleged that the story of 'Thudarum' is written with the skeleton of the screenplay of his 2020 film 'Theeyattam'.

Bobby Deol wishes son Aryaman on 24th birthday with rare selfie, celebs reactBobby Deol's heartwarming post for his son Aryaman's 24th birthday is winning hearts. He marked the occasion by sharing a rare selfie of the two together.

Simbu's film with Vetri Maaran goes on floors, Jailer director to play cameoActor Silambarasan's untitled film with director Vetri Maaran has commenced. A picture of the two and director Nelson Dilipkumar has been leaked on social media.

Doctor who gave ketamine to Matthew Perry, called actor moron, to plead guiltyDr. Salvador Plasencia, who was charged with supplying 'Friends' actor Matthew Perry with ketamine in the month leading up to his overdose death in 2023, has agreed to plead guilty, according to a signed document filed in federal court in Los Angeles.

Actor Ravi Mohan stars in companion Keneeshaa's single amid divorce with AartiActor Ravi Mohan played a cameo in his 'companion' Keneeshaa's music video, 'Andrum Indrum'. This video comes amid Ravi's divorce battle with his estranged wife, Aarti.
Mannara Chopra's father dies at 72, actor shares postActor Mannara Chopra's father, Raman Rai Handa, died on June 16. He was 72.

Aamir Khan responds to love jihad claims and PK backlashActor Aamir Khan finally addressed the controversy surrounding his 2014 film 'PK'. In an interview, he refuted claims that the film promoted 'love jihad'.

He felt lonely: Rahul Dev opens up about brother Mukul Dev's deathActor Rahul Dev revealed the reason behind his brother Mukul Dev's untimely death. He stated that he had lost the will to live following the death of their parents, and that his divorce further contributed to his emotional decline.

Jackson Wang on loneliness, Magic Man 2, and why India's on his radarJackson Wang, the Hong Kong-born singer and entrepreneur, is set to release his new album 'Magic Man 2' on July 18 and hopes to include India in his upcoming world tour. In an interview with India Today, he shared candid insights on independence, honesty, and his deep connection with fans.

general news.headline: New Air India crash videos show students jumping off balcony as smoke billowsSeveral videos have surfaced showing how people in nearby hostels tried to save their lives by climbing down from balconies after the London-bound Air India flight, with 242 on board, crashed into the BJ Medical College Hostel near Ahmedabad airport.

Publicity-seeking Macron: Trump denies Iran ceasefire claim, teases bigger move  Live UpdatesFrench President Emannuel Macron has claimed that US President Donald Trump has offered to broker a truce between Israel and Iran. Dismissing Macron's claims, Trump said that he had to cut short his G7 Summit meeting for a different reason and 'has nothing to do' with a ceasefire.

Air India London flight cancelled due to snag. Same route on which AI-171 crashedThe ill-fated AI-171, which crashed in Ahmedabad last week, killing 274 people, was retired after the incident and replaced with AI-159.

Not Karnataka High Court's role to demand apology: Top court slams Thug Life banThe Supreme Court strongly criticised Karnataka's ban on Thug Life, stating that mobs cannot dictate film screenings. It transferred the case to itself, slamming the Karnataka High Court over suggestions that the actor apologise to resolve the issue.

Why the Strait of Hormuz matters to India amid Israel-Iran tensionsThe Strait of Hormuz is located between Iran to the north and Oman and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to the south. It connects the Persian Gulf to the Gulf of Oman, and then to the Arabian Sea.

Chinese chatter: Why Beijing is worried about Modi's G7 visitAs PM Modi attends the G7 Summit, China watches closely, concerned over rare-earth diplomacy and India's balancing act between the West and Global South amid growing geopolitical unease.

Make-or-break moment? US, Iran talks likely this week on nuclear deal: ReportIran-Israel War: The meeting, if it goes through, could be a make-or-break moment in the conflict and decide if the US will join the offensive in a bid to eliminate Iran's nuclear program.

Boyfriend arrested for Haryana model's murder. She found out he was marriedThe body of Sheetal was recovered from a canal in Sonipat on Monday with slit marks around her neck. Her boyfriend has confessed to stabbing her to death.

The shadow of Sanjay: How Indira Gandhi's son shaped the EmergencyThe second part of the Democracy's Darkest Hour series chronicles how Indira Gandhi's doubts and her son Sanjay Gandhi's ambition triggered one of the most repressive chapters in India's political history.

Live: Israel claims to kill top Iran officer who took over after predecessor eliminatedIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: Both Israel and Iran launched several missiles at each other as the conflict entered its fifth day. Amid the ongoing crisis in the Middle East, G7 leaders gathered in Canada urged an end to hostilities between Iran and Israel, with French President Emmanuel Macron revealing that his US counterpart, Donald Trump, has already initiated a truce deal between the two warring nations. However, dismissing Macron's ceasefire claims, Trump said that he had left for Washington DC for something "much bigger than that." Trump did not clarify what issue prompted his sudden return but concluded his post with a cryptic "Stay Tuned!"

Israel on Tuesday warned over 3,30,000 people to evacuate central Tehran, signalling a possible escalation in its military offensive on Iran. 

Shortly after, the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) released footage and details of overnight airstrikes targeting Iranian military infrastructure in western Iran, describing the operation as a major blow to Tehran's missile capabilities.

Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Man puts chilli powder in wife's private parts, burns her with iron over 'affair'The woman alleged that her husband, who has been arrested, even tried to electrocute her and locked her in a room without food or water for two days.

India surpasses Pakistan in nuke arsenal, adds 8 more warheads: ReportAccording to the yearbook by the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute, India currently has 180 nuclear warheads as opposed to 170 in Pakistan's stockpile. India increased its arsenal size in 2025 by adding eight more warheads.

Victim mentality is your worst enemy. How to come out of itEven though it may seem like an easy escape or a way to avoid blame, victim mentality is actually a survival strategy for many. For them, it's not a choice they make, but a default setting imposed by life. However, it comes with many downsides.

Friend tied up, woman gang-raped during beach outing in Odisha; 10 arrestedThe accused, all adults, allegedly tied up the woman's friend, dragged her to an abandoned house near the Gopalpur sea beach in Odisha's Ganjam district, and took turns raping her.

Who's the teen whose terrace video might help solve Air India crash mysterySeventeen-year-old Aryan Asari was on the terrace of a three-storey building near the airport. Fascinated by low-flying flights, he began filming them so that he could share the clips with his friends. Moments later, he was horror-struck as Air India's Dreamliner 787-8 crashed before his eyes. He has since given his statement to the police as a witness.

Move out of Tehran: India issues fresh advisory as Iran-Israel conflict escalatesAmid escalating Israeli strikes on Tehran, the Indian Embassy has urged its nationals and PIOs to leave the city immediately and relocate to safer areas.

Rishi Sunak and Akshata Murty return to Stanford, where it all beganRishi Sunak and Akshata Murty returned to Stanford after two decades, sharing life lessons, laughter, and love at the very place where their journey began.
Nasa, Axiom Space reviewing Indian astronaut's Axiom-4 launch readinessThe Axe-4 mission is currently scheduled to launch on June 19; however, a launch time has yet to be released.

Bengaluru woman, senior citizen clash on 60% Kannada signage rule: This is IndiaA senior citizen and a businesswoman clashed in Bengaluru over Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's 60% Kannada language signboard rule. The woman claimed her board had Kannada, but the man insisted it didn't meet the requirement.

Intel to fire 20 per cent of its factory workforce in July, more job cuts likely to followIntel is reportedly planning to lay off 15–20 per cent of its factory workforce in July 2025. The upcoming layoffs will mark the first major cuts under new CEO Lip-Bu Tan.

Shimla woman clears toughest exams without coaching, bags Rank 1 in IIT entrancesDamini Singh Brar from Himachal Pradesh cleared IIT, NIMHANS, and UGC-NET without coaching. She will now pursue a PhD in Psychology from IIT Delhi after securing the top rank in the entrance exam.

Kochi-Delhi IndiGo flight makes emergency landing at Nagpur after bomb scareAn IndiGo flight, from Kochi to Delhi, made an emergency landing at Nagpur airport after it reportedly received a bomb threat.

Watch: Israel hits Tehran airport, destroys two US-made Iranian F-14 fighter jetsThe Israeli Air Force destroyed two Iranian F-14 fighter jets at a Tehran airport, the IDF said, sharing footage of the strike. The jets were reportedly meant to intercept Israeli aircraft. The IDF also hit Iranian drone units and broadcast facilities amid rising tensions.

Another Air India flight suffers technical snag, passengers deplaned in KolkataPassengers on Air India's San Francisco-Mumbai flight were asked to deplane in Kolkata after a snag was detected in the left engine during a scheduled halt, delaying the onward journey by hours.

sports.headline: Atmosphere for Chelsea's Club World Cup opener a bit strange: MarescaChelsea head coach Enzo Maresca admitted the atmosphere was "a bit strange" as his side began their FIFA Club World Cup campaign in front of nearly 50,000 empty seats at the Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta.

Rohit Sharma sends best wishes to Angelo Mathews for his final TestStar India batter Rohit Sharma sent his best wishes to Sri Lanka all-rounder Angelo Mathews, who's set to retire from Tests after the first game of the ongoing series against Bangladesh.

ICC plans 4-day Tests in 27-29 WTC cycle, Ind, Aus, Eng to play 5-day matchesThe ICC is set to sanction four-day Tests for smaller cricketing nations in the 2027-29 World Test Championship cycle. This change aims to help smaller countries play more Tests while traditional five-day matches will continue for India, Australia and England in major series.

Shubman Gill will be a perfect mix of Kohli and Rohit as captain: Jos ButtlerStar England batter Jos Buttler has predicted that Shubman Gill will be a perfect mix of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli as Test captain. Gill's first assignment as skipper will be the series against England.

Neeraj Chopra, Anderson Peters lead javelin start list in ParisNeeraj Chopra will compete in the Paris Diamond League on June 20, aiming for his first major title of the season. The seven-man javelin field will also feature Germany's Julian Weber and Grenada's Anderson Peters, promising a high-quality contest in Paris.

New Zealand's Sophie Devine set to retire from ODIs after Women's World CupNew Zealand captain Sophie Devine has announced that she will retire from Women's One-Day Internationals (ODIs) after the upcoming 50-over World Cup in India and Sri Lanka.

Harbhajan Singh suggests Sarfaraz Khan to learn from Karun Nair after India snubFormer India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has suggested Sarfaraz Khan after his team India snub for the upcoming Test series in England. Sarfaraz last played for India during the home Test series against New Zealand.

Air India crash: 23-year-old cricketer among victimsPromising AI graduate and cricketer Dirdh Patel, 23, has been named among the victims of the tragic Air India crash on Thursday. The London-bound flight, carrying 242 people, crashed moments after taking off from Ahmedabad, marking the world's worst aviation disaster in a decade.

Shubman Gill doesn't know what it means to be India Test captain: Dinesh KarthikFormer India cricketer Dinesh Karthik feels Shubman Gill isn't aware of what it means to be India's Test captain and will have a tough time in the upcoming series against England.

Ashwin and Dindigul Dragons cleared of ball-tampering allegationsFormer India off-spinner R Ashwin and Dindigul Dragons, the team he captains in the Tamil Nadu Premier League (TNPL), have been cleared of ball-tampering charges after allegations were levelled against them by Siechem Madurai Panthers.

Harbhajan Singh suggests Sarfaraz Khan to learn from Karun Nair after India snubFormer India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has suggested Sarfaraz Khan after his team India snub for the upcoming Test series in England. Sarfaraz last played for India during the home Test series against New Zealand.

Air India crash: 23-year-old cricketer among victimsPromising AI graduate and cricketer Dirdh Patel, 23, has been named among the victims of the tragic Air India crash on Thursday. The London-bound flight, carrying 242 people, crashed moments after taking off from Ahmedabad, marking the world's worst aviation disaster in a decade.

Shubman Gill doesn't know what it means to be India Test captain: Dinesh KarthikFormer India cricketer Dinesh Karthik feels Shubman Gill isn't aware of what it means to be India's Test captain and will have a tough time in the upcoming series against England.

Ashwin and Dindigul Dragons cleared of ball-tampering allegationsFormer India off-spinner R Ashwin and Dindigul Dragons, the team he captains in the Tamil Nadu Premier League (TNPL), have been cleared of ball-tampering charges after allegations were levelled against them by Siechem Madurai Panthers.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
